title: How to Make a Shiso Mojito

methods.name: Making a Green Tea Shiso Mojito

steps.headline: Muddle the lime juice, shiso and sugar together in a Collins glass using a muddler, a pestle or the back of a spoon.
steps.description: You want the leaves to be slightly bruised, and you want to smell the aroma of the shiso.

steps.headline: Add ice until the glass is 2/3 full.
Add the green tea and the rum to fill the glass.
Garnish the drink with a lime wedge or a shiso leaf, or both.
Tear 4 of the shiso leaves into large pieces, saving 1 whole leaf for garnish.
Muddle the brown sugar, shiso leaves and yuzu zest in the bottom of an old-fashioned glass.
Add the vodka, the lime juice and some ice cubes.
steps.description: Stir the drink with a spoon.

steps.headline: Top the drink with club soda and with more ice, as needed.
Garnish with the reserved shiso leaf.

text: Making a Green Tea Shiso Mojito Muddle the lime juice, shiso and sugar together in a Collins glass using a muddler, a pestle or the back of a spoon. You want the leaves to be slightly bruised, and you want to smell the aroma of the shiso. Add ice until the glass is 2/3 full.  Add the green tea and the rum to fill the glass.  Garnish the drink with a lime wedge or a shiso leaf, or both.  Making a Shiso Yuzu Mojito Tear 4 of the shiso leaves into large pieces, saving 1 whole leaf for garnish.  Muddle the brown sugar, shiso leaves and yuzu zest in the bottom of an old-fashioned glass.  Add the vodka, the lime juice and some ice cubes. Stir the drink with a spoon. Top the drink with club soda and with more ice, as needed.  Garnish with the reserved shiso leaf.
